content.raw:
The <joint><pose> is the one that's currently being used, and it's defined relative to the child. I expect when we implement the new pose tags, that we'll remove the <joint><pose> tag.

No, <pose> in the parent won't always be the opposite of child pose. That was a misleading example I gave. The parent pose will eventually specify the anchor location and axis direction relative to the parent link frame.
content.html:
The <joint><pose> is the one that's currently being used, and it's defined relative to the child. I expect when we implement the new pose tags, that we'll remove the <joint><pose> tag.

No, <pose> in the parent won't always be the opposite of child pose. That was a misleading example I gave. The parent pose will eventually specify the anchor location and axis direction relative to the parent link frame.
